attributes.action: stand AGAINST the ECHR's motion that prisoners should be enfranchised.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The right to vote bears responsibilities and a civic duty and it should remain a privilege to the law-abiding population of the United Kingdom. Those who choose to disregard this duty are justifiably penalised with being denied the vote.

This farcical ruling, which states that disenfranchising prisoners is in breach of their 'human rights', merely highlights the irresponsibility of the European federal state which seemingly seeks to impose hyped-up liberalism in its most vacuous form. 

The undersigned are deeply apprehensive and displeased with this decision. We seek an act of good will by the Prime Minister and Parliament to restore confidence in the judicial system and in our working democracy.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
